page.title: 17ARTS IN SOUTHSEA
page.content: Craftwork has become increasingly popular as the rate of unemployment has risen, especially traditionally male crafts such as{fretwork, {marquetry and carving.}Other local crafts people produce{quilted clothes, {lacework,corn idols,jewellery,spinning and{smocking.}One problem is that materials can be expensive.The work is of a high standard. One man has carved for the Royal Family and Princess Anne's daughter wears dresses smocked by a local needlewoman. Most{local artwork}is done by retired people, who like to paint landscapes,traditional seascapes and harbour scenes. Unfortunately there seems to be little interest in art in Southsea despite the nearby art college.Local galleries such as Hiscocks are closing down.
